docs.lead_paragraph: Banking regulation needs to speak one language, the head of the European Central Bank's supervisory watchdog was quoted as saying on Sunday, adding that differing interpretations of the same regulations had created some distortions in the euro area.

headline.main: ECB's Nouy Says Differing Rule Interpretations Cause Imbalances

docs.lead_paragraph: SMITH--Howard. NYU Lutheran's board and staff are deeply saddened by the passing of chair emeritus Howard Smith. As chairman of Lutheran Medical Center and Augustana Center from 1966 until 2004, Smith, who died Thursday at age 85, left an indelible legacy on southwest Brooklyn. With his friend New York City Mayor John Lindsay and the American Lutheran Church, Mr. Smith brokered the 1977 expansion and relocation of Lutheran Medical Center from 4th Avenue and 46th Street to its present location, a former warehouse at 55th Street and 2nd Avenue in Sunset Park. He facilitated the creation of the Sunset Park Family Health Center, now called NYU Lutheran Family Health Centers, the second largest federally qualified health center network in the nation. He created a lasting financial foundation for Lutheran through Health Plus, an innovative government-sponsored insurance program for low-income residents. Lutheran's sale of Health Plus to Amerigroup in 2011 created an endowment that continues to help modernize the health system. Mr. Smith, a lifelong Brooklyn resident, was chairman emeritus of the United Hospital Fund, former president of the Brooklyn Public Library Board of Trustees, and past vice president and director of the Brooklyn Chamber of Commerce. Mr. Smith received a bachelor's in chemical engineering from Princeton University and served in the U.S. Army. He served 40 years as president of Virginia Dare Extract Company, which was founded by his grandfather Bernard, and was a former director of Dime Savings Bank of New York before it merged with Washington Mutual in 2002. He is predeceased by his wife, Elsie, and survived by his three children, Howard Jr., Jean, and Lilla, and grandchildren. NYU Lutheran mourns as we celebrate Mr. Smith's life and legacy. A wake will be held at Clavin Funeral Home, 7722 4th Ave., Brooklyn, on Tuesday, February 2, at 4-8pm. Services will be held at the Lutheran Church of the Good Shepherd, 7420 4th Ave., Brooklyn, on Wednesday, February 3, at 10 am. 1/3

docs.lead_paragraph: In interviews, supporters of Mr. Trump expressed concern about terrorists coming across the border, while Mr. Sanders’s backers were anxious about the growing inequality in wealth and income.

headline.main: Bernie Sanders and Donald Trump Voters Share Anger, but Direct It Differently
headline.print_headline: They’re Mad and Sure Their Guy Is the One to Lead the Fight

docs.abstract: Iowan supporters of Donald J Trump and Bernie Sanders share sense of disempowerment, anger at American political system and conviction that only their candidate is capable of fixing it; groups, who skew white and male and equal one another in passion, stand to influence course of 2016 presidential election.
docs.snippet: In interviews, supporters of Mr. Trump expressed concern about terrorists coming across the border, while Mr. Sanders’s backers were anxious about the growing inequality in wealth and income.

docs.lead_paragraph: What caused the worst American rail disaster in decades?
docs.abstract: Ongoing investigation is trying to determine what caused crash of Amtrak train 1888 near Philadelphia in May 2015; officials have questioned state of mind of engineer Brandon Bostian, long respected for his vigilance, pointed to difficulty of section of track where accident occurred and lamented lack of safety controls.
docs.snippet: What caused the worst American rail disaster in decades?

headline.main: Hillary Clinton Criticizes Bernie Sanders and Ted Cruz on Healthcare

docs.abstract: Hillary Clinton staked out her position as the lone defender of the Affordable Care Act on Saturday night, warning that her Democratic rival, Senator Bernie Sanders, would scrap it and start over and that Republicans would hand healthcare back to insurers and drug-makers.

headline.main: Uncomfortable Question for Ted Cruz on Obamacare Silences the Room

docs.abstract: A Hillary Clinton supporter whose brother-in-law, uninsured until the Affordable Care Act, died of cancer, asked Senator Ted Cruz what he would replace the law with if he dismantled it.
